best_practices.overview: Best practices for creating high-quality, effective bootcamp materials that deliver value to clients and ensure successful learning outcomes.

principle.name: conversational_guidance
principle.description: Guide users through a conversational Q&A process

guidelines.guideline: Ask one question at a time
Make it easy to choose without extensive typing

ask_followup_question.question: What is the client's primary programming language and key frameworks?

follow_up.suggest: Java with Spring Boot and Angular
Let me specify their exact stack

example.bad: "What technologies does the client use?" (too vague, no suggestions)

principle.name: validate_early_and_often
principle.description: Validate information as it's collected, not at the end

guidelines.guideline: Check for completeness after each phase

principle.name: provide_context
principle.description: Help users understand the purpose of each question

guidelines.guideline: Explain how information will be used

principle.example: "I need to know your tech stack so I can customize all lab exercises with examples in your programming language and frameworks. This ensures participants practice with tools they actually use."

principle.name: offer_smart_defaults
principle.description: Suggest reasonable defaults based on common patterns

guidelines.guideline: Allocate 40-50% of time to client-specific work

principle.name: progressive_disclosure
principle.description: Start with essential information, add details progressively

guidelines.guideline: Required fields first, optional fields later
Core use cases before edge cases
Basic tech stack before detailed tools

principle.name: always_be_specific
principle.description: Never use generic examples - always tailor to client

guidelines.guideline: Use realistic file paths for their project structure

examples.bad: "Update the config file" "Fix the bug in the code" "Add a new function"
examples.good: "Update the timeout value in config/settings.py to 30 seconds" "Fix the NullPointerException in PaymentService.processPayment() on line 145" "Add a validateEmail() function to src/utils/validators.ts"

principle.name: match_skill_levels
principle.description: Adjust complexity based on participant experience

guidelines.guideline: More juniors → slower pace, more explanation, simpler examples
More seniors → faster pace, advanced topics, complex scenarios
Mixed levels → provide optional advanced content

principle.name: respect_time_constraints
principle.description: Ensure content fits within available time

guidelines.guideline: Calculate realistic timing for each exercise
Prioritize high-value use cases if time is limited
Suggest what to skip or do as homework if needed

principle.name: use_real_problems
principle.description: Base Lab 3 on actual business problems

guidelines.guideline: Reference real pain points from client
Use actual APIs, services, or systems
Same tech stack in all labs
Aligned timing across config and schedule

principle.name: clear_objectives
principle.description: Every exercise must have clear, measurable objectives

example.good: "By the end of this exercise, you will be able to: - Use apply_diff to make precise code changes - Refactor a function without breaking tests - Add proper error handling to API endpoints"

principle.name: actionable_instructions
principle.description: Instructions must be clear and actionable

guidelines.guideline: Use specific verbs (read, update, add, fix)

principle.name: realistic_examples
principle.description: Examples must be executable and realistic

guidelines.guideline: File paths exist in typical projects
Commands will work in client's environment
Data is realistic for the domain
Lab 3: Real business problems, full scenarios

principle.name: include_bob_workflows
principle.description: Show how to use Bob effectively for each task

guidelines.guideline: Include time for questions and troubleshooting

principle.name: buffer_time
principle.description: Always include buffer for overruns and questions

guidelines.guideline: Allow time for setup and transitions

principle.name: break_allocation
principle.description: Include adequate breaks for participant comfort

guidelines.guideline: 3+ hours: At least one 10-15 minute break
Every 90 minutes: Short break or transition

principle.name: priority_based_allocation
principle.description: Allocate more time to high-priority use cases

guidelines.guideline: Low priority: 10-20 minutes or skip if time limited

pitfall.name: generic_examples
pitfall.description: Using generic examples instead of client-specific ones
pitfall.impact: Participants can't relate to examples, reduced engagement
pitfall.solution: Always customize examples to client's tech stack and domain

pitfall.name: unrealistic_timing
pitfall.impact: Rushed exercises, incomplete learning, frustrated participants
pitfall.solution: Use realistic estimates, include buffer time, prioritize ruthlessly

pitfall.name: too_many_use_cases
pitfall.description: Trying to cover too many use cases in limited time
pitfall.impact: Superficial coverage, no depth, participants overwhelmed
pitfall.solution: Focus on 2-3 high-priority use cases, do them well

pitfall.name: inconsistent_tech_stack
pitfall.impact: Confusion, reduced learning transfer, wasted time
pitfall.solution: Validate tech stack consistency across all materials

pitfall.name: missing_validation
pitfall.impact: Errors discovered during bootcamp, lost credibility
pitfall.solution: Always run full validation before marking complete

pitfall.name: placeholder_content
pitfall.description: Leaving template placeholders in final materials
pitfall.solution: Scan for placeholders, ensure all are replaced

factor.name: client_focus
factor.description: Keep client's needs at the center

actions.action: Explain what you're doing and why
Ask for feedback on generated content

category.name: before_starting
category.item: Understand the client's industry and context

category.name: during_creation
category.item: Customize all examples to their stack
